docker.name: RUN
docker.args: apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends 		tcl 		tk 	&& rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
docker.raw: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends 		tcl 		tk 	&& rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

docker.name: RUN
docker.args: set -ex; 	# this "case" statement is generated via "update.sh"
docker.raw: RUN set -ex; 	# this "case" statement is generated via "update.sh"

docker.name: S390X)
docker.args: pypyArch='s390x'; sha256='0fe2f7bbf42ea88b40954d7de773a43179a44f40656f2f58201524be70699544' ;; 		*) echo >&2 "error: current architecture ($dpkgArch) does not have a corresponding PyPy $PYPY_VERSION binary release"; exit 1 ;; 	esac; 		wget -O pypy.tar.bz2 "https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/downloads/pypy3.6-v${PYPY_VERSION}-${pypyArch}.tar.bz2" --progress=dot:giga; 	echo "$sha256 *pypy.tar.bz2" | sha256sum -c; 	tar -xjC /usr/local --strip-components=1 -f pypy.tar.bz2; 	find /usr/local/lib-python -depth -type d -a \( -name test -o -name tests \) -exec rm -rf '{}' +; 	rm pypy.tar.bz2; 	# smoke test
docker.raw: s390x) pypyArch='s390x'; sha256='0fe2f7bbf42ea88b40954d7de773a43179a44f40656f2f58201524be70699544' ;; 		*) echo >&2 "error: current architecture ($dpkgArch) does not have a corresponding PyPy $PYPY_VERSION binary release"; exit 1 ;; 	esac; 		wget -O pypy.tar.bz2 "https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/downloads/pypy3.6-v${PYPY_VERSION}-${pypyArch}.tar.bz2" --progress=dot:giga; 	echo "$sha256 *pypy.tar.bz2" | sha256sum -c; 	tar -xjC /usr/local --strip-components=1 -f pypy.tar.bz2; 	find /usr/local/lib-python -depth -type d -a \( -name test -o -name tests \) -exec rm -rf '{}' +; 	rm pypy.tar.bz2; 	# smoke test

docker.name: PYPY3
docker.args: --version; 		if [ -f /usr/local/lib_pypy/_ssl_build.py ]; then # on pypy3, rebuild ffi bits for compatibility with Debian Stretch+ (https://github.com/docker-library/pypy/issues/24#issuecomment-409408657)
docker.raw: pypy3 --version; 		if [ -f /usr/local/lib_pypy/_ssl_build.py ]; then # on pypy3, rebuild ffi bits for compatibility with Debian Stretch+ (https://github.com/docker-library/pypy/issues/24#issuecomment-409408657)

docker.name: CD
docker.args: /usr/local/lib_pypy; 		pypy3 _ssl_build.py; # TODO rebuild other cffi modules here too
docker.raw: cd /usr/local/lib_pypy; 		pypy3 _ssl_build.py; # TODO rebuild other cffi modules here too

docker.name: FI;
docker.args: find /usr/local -depth 		\( 			\( -type d -a \( -name test -o -name tests \) \) 			-o 			\( -type f -a \( -name '*.pyc' -o -name '*.pyo' \) \) 		\) -exec rm -rf '{}' +
docker.raw: fi; 	find /usr/local -depth 		\( 			\( -type d -a \( -name test -o -name tests \) \) 			-o 			\( -type f -a \( -name '*.pyc' -o -name '*.pyo' \) \) 		\) -exec rm -rf '{}' +

docker.name: RUN
docker.args: set -ex; 		wget -O get-pip.py "$PYTHON_GET_PIP_URL"; 	echo "$PYTHON_GET_PIP_SHA256 *get-pip.py" | sha256sum --check --strict -; 		pypy3 get-pip.py 		--disable-pip-version-check 		--no-cache-dir 		"pip==$PYTHON_PIP_VERSION" 	; # smoke test
docker.raw: RUN set -ex; 		wget -O get-pip.py "$PYTHON_GET_PIP_URL"; 	echo "$PYTHON_GET_PIP_SHA256 *get-pip.py" | sha256sum --check --strict -; 		pypy3 get-pip.py 		--disable-pip-version-check 		--no-cache-dir 		"pip==$PYTHON_PIP_VERSION" 	; # smoke test

docker.name: PIP
docker.args: --version; 		find /usr/local -depth 		\( 			\( -type d -a \( -name test -o -name tests \) \) 			-o 			\( -type f -a \( -name '*.pyc' -o -name '*.pyo' \) \) 		\) -exec rm -rf '{}' +; 	rm -f get-pip.py
docker.raw: pip --version; 		find /usr/local -depth 		\( 			\( -type d -a \( -name test -o -name tests \) \) 			-o 			\( -type f -a \( -name '*.pyc' -o -name '*.pyo' \) \) 		\) -exec rm -rf '{}' +; 	rm -f get-pip.py
